# Task

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.



# Data

extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""")

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    julia_code = ""
    in_codeblock = false
    for line in split(md, '\n')
        if !in_codeblock && startswith(line, "```julia")
            in_codeblock = true
        elseif in_codeblock && (endswith(line, "```") || isempty(line))
            in_codeblock = false
        elseif in_codeblock
            julia_code *= line * "\n"
        end
    end
    return strip(julia_code)
end

# Example Usage
md = """
# Heading

Some text

```julia
println("hello world")
```

More text

```julia
a = 10
b = 20
c = a + b
println(c)
```
"""

extract_julia_code(md) # Output: "println(\"hello world\");\na = 10;\nb = 20;\nc = a + b;\nprintln(c)"
